Message.Title: Minuteman founder charged
Message.Msg: By David Schwartz PHOENIX | Wed Jun 19, 2013 10:49pm EDT (Reuters) - The co-founder of the Minutemen civilian border patrol group that for several years watched for unauthorized immigrants crossing to Arizona from Mexico, was arrested on Wednesday on suspicion of molesting three young girls. Chris Simcox, 52, who co-founded the Minuteman Civil Defense Corps in 2005, was booked into a Maricopa County jail in connection with the molestation of three girls under the age of 10, said Sergeant Tommy Thompson, a Phoenix police spokesman. Detectives with the department's Family Investigations Bureau developed "probable cause" that Simcox had sexual conduct with the girls during the past several months, Thompson said. No other details were immediately available. Simcox has denied the allegations to police. It was not known if he had an attorney. He faces two counts each of child molestation and sexual conduct with a minor, and one count of attempted child molestation. A former kindergarten teacher from California, Simcox co-founded the border watch group to highlight what he said was the government's failure to secure the porous southwest border with Mexico. Its force of housewives, office workers and veterans sat in lawn chairs in southern Arizona, spotting suspected migrants whom they reported to the U.S. Border Patrol, until the group disbanded in 2010. The U.S. Senate is debating comprehensive immigration reform that aims to tighten security on the border with Mexico while offering millions of illegal immigrants living in the United States a path to citizenship.

Message.Title: so when will Snowden denounce China's aggressive surveillance, hacking & espionage programs?
Message.Msg: why hasn't Snowden denounced China's aggressive surveillance, hacking & espionage programs? . Hey snowden: "there are some two million Chinese spies working with the communist state’s security apparatus".... will you please whine about how unethical that is to them while you are there?......... ".... communiist Party officials do not want to make a big deal out of Snowden, lest it encourage debate about the government's own aggressive domestic programs. "but many attacks originating in China are believed to come from special cyber units belonging to the Chinese military. A recent report by Mandiant, a northern Virginia cybersecurity firm, identified a Chinese military detachment known as Unit 61398 as one of the “most prolific” hacking groups in the world. The military link suggests China considers economic dominance a matter of national defense, raising the stakes for any western firms it targets..................... there are some two million Chinese spies working with the communist state’s security apparatus. The regime has countless agencies engaged in intelligence gathering, including the Ministry of State Security; various military intelligence agencies; multiple industrial, political, and economic espionage departments; and more. Hiding behind “diplomatic immunity” and using blackmail, bribery, special privileges, strategic “business” partnerships, cyber attacks, and a wide array of other methods, China’s spies have been extremely successful in their efforts.

Topic.Title: Good News on a Bad day!

Message.Msg: They pulled a reverse split to stay listed. It kept the stock price reasonable for the exchange and though it had obvious negative connotations (and still does) it probably made for easier bookkeeping and a less volatile stock. On the down side it also meant they had to prove they could eat whatever losses were coming and still remain a viable business. I thought they had a shot at it so I started buying. It's taken awhile but I think they're just about to hit a point where ever a comparatively mild decrease in defaults will make a significant difference based on the governments current weird formula for provisioning. Once unencumbered the business itself should be very profitable and significantly more valuable than its current market cap suggests.

Message.Title: Obamacare- news just keeps getting better!!
Message.Msg: Health Care Plans Under Obamacare Will Cost Even Less Than Expected By Sy Mukherjee A new analysis of health care premiums proposed under the Affordable Care Act concludes that health plans will cost even less than originally expected. That’s likely because the insurance marketplaces will encourage more competition between insurers. Avalere Health looked at insurers’ proposed rates for Obamacare’s statewide insurance marketplaces in nine different states, and found that premiums for a 40 year old non-smoker on a mid-level health plan will cost anywhere from a low of $205 (in one Oregon region) to a high of $413 (in one Vermont region). That high-end price is actually lower than what the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) predicted the average mid-level plan cost would be in 2016. Avalere’s report comes with some important caveats: the analysis is limited to 2014 premiums, whereas CBO’s projections deal with 2016 rates. Critics may argue that insurers are offering deceptively low rates to attract consumers in the health law’s first year of implementation, but plan on jacking those charges up once they have a larger customer base. But insurers wouldn’t necessarily be able to do that under Obamacare, since the law subjects any premium hike over 10 percent by insurers selling plans on a marketplace to review. Furthermore, sicker Americans are expected to take advantage of the law’s protections before healthier and younger Americans enter the individual insurance market, meaning that future rate increases could be mitigated by a less costly pool.

Topic.Title: They are buying the Oct $13 calls today

Message.Msg: Well at least he left behind a gold mine for people. I couldn't believe it when it was actually trading under $8 for alittle while. I took profits on those temporary positions, but those profits bought me a big pile of LEAPS to hold onto until they go long term. I also have a lump of stock, which I sometimes trade in and out bits of it, the other already being long term . . . Besides, I'm not even close to worrying about long term versus short term my gains have been so pathetic. I've taken like 3500 in realized short term and 500 in realized long term gains net of losses, but I still have unrealized losses on my books that are holding me down. But when I am ready to sell the shares I expect that sale will make me grateful for holding long term rather than repeated short term cycling. If I liquidate the LEAPS and long term position in Jan '15 that alone would generate enough gains that it would push me into a tax bracket that actually required I pay taxes. That would PROFOUNDLY suck. My brokerage account started as a mad money account, and has now grown large enough its actually something to pay attention to more closely than I have in the past.

Topic.Title: Obamacare- news just keeps getting better!!

Message.Msg: any SINGLE premium hike over 10%. Does that mean it's limited to 9.9% a year, or 9.9% a quarter, or 9.9% a month, or could they hike rates on a daily basis? All that and more has yet to be written into law. Obamacare was a draft document in unfinished form filled with contradictions, that still has to be legislated into some form of sanity before any of this is even worth discussing. Parts of it are functioning, true, at least the parts that collect money, but other parts have proven to be utterly unworkable, like the insurance for the uninsurable plan that was cancelled 6 months after they started taking applications because they'd already overcommitted their budget by 100%. Theoretically that plan was supposed to run indefinitely. The President has, if nothing else, learned a great deal about the differences between a theoretical ideal universe and the one we live in.

Topic.Title: Obamacare- news just keeps getting better!!

Message.Msg: Nitpicking and obfuscation won't hide the BIG truths about Obamacare: 71 Million Kids & Adults With Private Insurance Have Received No-Cost Preventive Care. “HHS estimates that, as a result of the ACA, 71 million children and adults with private insurance, and 34 million Medicare beneficiaries have received no-cost preventive care. Enhanced federal matching funds in Medicaid are available to states providing all USPSTF-recommended preventive benefits without cost-sharing, but, to date, few states have made the changes required to gain the higher match rate.” “Health Reform-The Affordable Care Act Three Years Post-Enactment,” Kaiser Family Foundation, March 2013.

Police use an electronic stun gun to subdue a Brentwood man at a gun control rally in Concord. Topic.Title: Obamacare- news just keeps getting better!!

Message.Msg: Discrimination By Insurance Companies For Children With Pre-Existing Conditions Was Banned. “Coverage exclusions for children with pre-existing conditions were prohibited as of September 23, 2010. Insurers are no longer permitted to deny coverage to children due to their health status, or exclude coverage for pre-existing conditions. Protections for adults will take effect in 2014. In addition, lifetime limits on coverage in private insurance have been eliminated and annual limits are being phased out.” “Health Reform-The Affordable Care Act Three Years Post-Enactment,” Kaiser Family Foundation, March 2013.

Message.Title: The search for GOP moderates
Message.Msg: National Review has found several dozen moderate Republicans fighting back against their party's right-wing lurch: The Tuesday Group, a moderate-Republican caucus long ignored within the House GOP, is quietly starting to fight back against the conference’s right turn. In fact, it's so quiet that you basically can't hear them at all. Apparently, there are supposed be 30 or 40 members of The Tuesday Group, but the National Review must have a pretty weird definition of "fight back" because you'd never know it from the evidence they provide. Their first example is of Rep. Steve Womack from Arkansas complaining to Eric Cantor about how the Heritage Foundation is attacking some Republicans for being insufficiently pure. And their second example is of Rep. Charlie Dent from Pennsylvania, who publicly criticized Republicans for holding this week's abortion ban vote. If this is what counts as moderates fighting back ... then the GOP is every bit as nutty as we think it is. In the case of Womack, he was complaining about an external group—nothing inside the House Republican Conference. And in the case of Dent, he did complain about the vote, and he did vote against it—but he was one of only six Republicans to do so, and some of those six voted no because they opposed the rape exception. So much for 30 to 40 members, right? And that leads me to my favorite line from the article: One GOP aide explained to me, “I wish the Tuesday Group were more active. It would help fight the caricature that we are all a bunch of right-wing nutjobs.” Except there's a reason it's not more active. It's because they are a bunch of right-wing nutjobs.

Message.Title: I'll Praise Ya While I Kiil Ya!....
Message.Msg: You can't make this stuff up!... The Atlanta Journal-Constitution An Atlanta bishop and well known gospel singer was arrested Wednesday afternoon for allegedly taking a gun to Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport. Bishop William Henry Murphy III was carrying a 9 mm handgun in his carry-on luggage, according to the warrant by the Clayton County Police Department. A Transportation Security Administration official allegedly discovered the weapon during an X-ray screening. Murphy does have a license to carry permit, the warrant states. Murphy is the bishop of The dReam Center Church. He also is a prominent gospel singer. His song “Praise is What I Do” has more than 4.5 million views on YouTube. According to the church’s Facebook page, Murphy had just been consecrated from pastor to bishop on Monday. Murphy was charged with misdemeanor possession of a weapon in an unauthorized area. He appeared in court Thursday, where the judge set his bond at $2,500. He could face civil penalties of up to $7,500, according to Channel 2 Action News.
